BioStat | R package
  • Functions

Make a compact letter display for pair-wise comparison

Make a compact letter display for results of pair-wise comparisons (e.g., ANOVA post-hoc tests, Kruskal-Wallis post-hoc tests and other).

make_cld(obj, ..., alpha = 0.05)

# S3 method for pairwise.htest
make_cld(obj, ..., alpha = 0.05)

# S3 method for posthocTGH
make_cld(obj, ..., alpha = obj$intermediate$alpha)

# S3 method for posthoc_tgh
make_cld(obj, ..., alpha = obj$intermediate$alpha)

# S3 method for PMCMR
make_cld(obj, ..., alpha = 0.05)

Arguments

obj

Object with pair-wise comparisons (e.g., post-hoc test results). Currently supported objects:

  • posthocTGH from package userfriendlyscience;

  • PMCMR from package PMCMR.
...

Further arguments to methods.
alpha

(numeric from 0 to 1) Significance level.

Value

(A data frame with) compact letter display.

Details

This function is based on function cldList() from package rcompanion.

Examples

# Example 1: class `pairwise.htest`

obj1 <- pairwise.wilcox.test(chickwts$weight, chickwts$feed, exact = FALSE)
make_cld(obj1)
#>       Group cld mono_cld
#> 1    casein   a      a__
#> 2 horsebean   b      _b_
#> 3   linseed  bc      _bc
#> 4  meatmeal  ac      a_c
#> 5   soybean   c      __c
#> 6 sunflower   a      a__


# Example 2: class `pairwise.htest`

obj2 <- pairwise.t.test(OrchardSprays$decrease, OrchardSprays$treatment)
make_cld(obj2)
#>   Group cld mono_cld
#> 1     A   a      a__
#> 2     B   a      a__
#> 3     C   a      a__
#> 4     D  ab      ab_
#> 5     E  bc      _bc
#> 6     F   c      __c
#> 7     G   c      __c
#> 8     H   c      __c


# Example 3: class `PMCMR`


obj3 <- PMCMR::posthoc.kruskal.conover.test(count ~ spray,
                                            data = InsectSprays)
#> Warning: Ties are present. Quantiles were corrected for ties.
make_cld(obj3)
#>   Group cld mono_cld
#> 1     A   a      a__
#> 2     B   a      a__
#> 3     C   b      _b_
#> 4     D   c      __c
#> 5     E  bc      _bc
#> 6     F   a      a__

# Example 4: class `posthocTGH`

obj4 <- posthoc_tgh(ChickWeight$weight,
                    ChickWeight$Diet,
                    method = "tukey")
make_cld(obj4)
#>   Group cld mono_cld
#> 1     2  ab       ab
#> 2     3   a       a_
#> 3     4   a       a_
#> 4     1   b       _b


# Example 5: class `posthoc_tgh`

obj5 <- posthoc_tgh(ChickWeight$weight,
                    ChickWeight$Diet,
                    method = "games-howell")
make_cld(obj5)
#>   Group cld mono_cld
#> 1     2  ab       ab
#> 2     3   a       a_
#> 3     4   a       a_
#> 4     1   b       _b
